description.p: On the Linux management machines, the netmond user can execute the following script via sudo:
This script is writable by the netmonclientd user. This allows escalating from the netmonclientd user to root.

technicaldescription.p: Edit ''/usr/local/netmonclientd/init'' on the management machines as the netmonclientd user, since the script can be invoked with "/bin/bash" to elevate privileges to root (uid=0).

recommendation.p: Change owner of the ''/usr/local/netmonclientd/init'' (on the management machines) to root so the netmonclientd user cannot write to it.
